info.name: VideoAsk
info.description:
Welcome to the VideoAsk API documentation!

Our APIs allow to create videoasks dynamically and retrieve data.

**The best and most painless way to retrieve responses (in real-time), is to set up response webhooks in the "Connect** ðŸ”Œ**" tab of any of your videoasks inside the app.**

![](https://p-XwF1OejJ.b4.n0.cdn.getcloudapp.com/items/llu6N8mP/34927078-d29e-4306-a244-880a9e3f9332.gif?v=8f393425cbe3bb00be1c04b212b63578)

[Check out the documentation](https://developers.videoask.com/#50000ed2-5e56-4747-b060-2dba7ef22991)  
/ [See where to find webhooks](https://www.videoask.com/help/integrations/add-webhooks-to-your-videoasks)

item.name: Glossary of terms
item.description:
**VideoAsk**

The product/tool available at videoask.com

**Form** *(aka videoask)*

The video question sequence that can be created and sent using **VideoAsk**.

**Question** *(aka videoask step)*

An individual question/step from a **form.**

**Form Author** *(aka creator)*

You! The person who creates the **form**.

**Contact** *(aka respondent)*

The person who responds to your **form**. 

If the **Form** has contact details collection enabled, the contact can have a **name**, an **email** and a **phone number** associated to it. 

Contacts get created on each page load of the videoask. 
All the answers in the session will get associated with the same contact. 
However, if the person refreshes the page and answers the same videoask multiple times, then different contacts will be created.

As the contact interacts with the videoask page, its status changes as shown in the following picture:
![videoask contact status flow](https://res.cloudinary.com/videoask/image/upload/v1598441350/public-assets/videoask-contact-status-flow.png)


**Answer** 

An individual answer from a **contact** to a question.

**Response**

The group of **answers** from a **contact** to a **form**.

**Message** *(aka reply)*

Can have two different **author types**:

- `form_author`: messages sent from the **form author** to the **contact.**
- `contact`: messages sent from the **contact** to the form_author.

**Conversation**

The group of **messages** between a creator and a respondent.

**Interaction**

All-encompassing term of any interaction with a **contact** (answers & messages).

item.name: Changelog
item.description:
## December 28th
We introduced `folders` endpoints:
* Create a Folder
* Update a Folder
* Delete a Folder

## Upcoming breaking changes
## December 9th
We will change some responses from our API.
- The following endpoints will always return paginated responses:
```
GET /forms
GET /questions/<question_id>/answers
GET /messages
```
to avoid any errors or interruptions please make your applications send the query-param `limit` and/or `offset` to those endpoints.
- All listing endpoints will stop including the field `count` by default. If you need this information, send the query-param `with_count=1`
- Removal of deprecated endpoints:
```
GET /contacts/<contact_id>
GET /threads/<thread_id>
```

## September 2nd

This Thursday we introduced a new field in the contact form to show or not a consent check. It's called `requires_consent`.

Also, we included a field in contact response called `consent_given`, that returns if the consent was given or not. 

## August 13th

Added the new message webhooks event types: `form_author_message` and `form_contact_message`


## July 30th

This Thursday we will be introducing a small breaking change on api `GET /forms`
- field `respondents_count` will always return `0`
- field inside poll_options `total_count`  will always return `0`
- field inside first_question `answers_count` will always return `0`
- field inside first_question `last_answer` will always return `null`

Later in August weâ€™re planning to the following changes to the same endpoint:
remove the fields mentioned above fields all together from this endpoint
enforce pagination

This what we recommend doing in order to prepare for these changes:
- always send `offset` and `limit` in the query string of `GET /forms`
- instead of `respondents_count`, use `count` from `GET /forms/{{form_id}}/contacts`
- for retrieving questionâ€™s `answer_count` and options's `total_count`, use the new `GET /questions/{{question_id}}/insights` endpoint

item.name: Authentication

urlencoded.description: Unique secret identifier for VideoAsk clients.
URL where the application should redirect. Should contain the same value as the `redirect_uri` you've given us when you requested API access. Used only for verification.

request.description:
Now that the application has a temporary authorization code, it can request an access token with `POST https://auth.videoask.com/oauth/token`, sending the temporary authorization code, `client_id`, `client_secret`, and `redirect_uri` in the request body.

Your application's https://auth.videoask.com/oauth/token request, including the body, might look like this:

```
curl --request POST \
  --url https://auth.videoask.com/oauth/token \
  --data-urlencode 'grant_type=authorization_code' \
  --data-urlencode 'code={temporary_authorization_code}' \
  --data-urlencode 'client_id={your_client_id}' \
  --data-urlencode 'client_secret={your_client_secret}' \
  --data-urlencode 'redirect_uri=https://your-example-app.com/callback'
```


Your applications should then pass the access token in the Authorization header of every request.

After the token expires, your application won't be able to make requests with that token. You will need to get a new token either through the OAuth2 authentication process or by using the token refresh process (below).

urlencoded.description: Unique secret identifier for VideoAsk clients.

request.description:
If your application needs to call the VideoAsk API over longer periods of time without user involvement, your application can request a special refresh token during the first authentication call, then use this refresh token to obtain new access tokens without asking for user permission each time.

To receive a refresh token in the first place, your application must pass an extra `offline` scope during the authorization code request:

```
https://auth.videoask.com/authorize?response_type=code&audience=https://api.videoask.com/&client_id=${your_client_id}&scope=openid%20profile%20email%20offline_access&redirect_uri=${your_redirect_url}

```

If the user agrees to grant your application the required permissions, in the authorization code response to the access token exchange request, your application will receive the `access_token` and an extra parameter called `refresh_token`. You can use the value of this `refresh_token` parameter to obtain a new access token at any time as per [RFC 6749](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-6).

```
curl --request POST \
  --url https://auth.videoask.com/oauth/token \
  --data-urlencode 'grant_type=refresh_token' \
  --data-urlencode 'refresh_token={your_refresh_token}' \
  --data-urlencode 'client_id={your_client_id}' \
  --data-urlencode 'client_secret={your_client_secret}' \
  --data-urlencode 'scope=openid profile email offline_access'

```

The response for this request is nearly identical to the response for the authorization code to the access token exchange request. A new access token will be returned in the response.

item.description:
To play around with the API you should obtain your temporary authentication token by logging into https://app.videoask.com/app and navigating to your [**Account > API section**](https://app.videoask.com/app/account?tab=api).

To obtain your production API credentials, you should Register a new app in your **Organization Settings > Developer Apps** section.

You can find an walkthrough guide here: https://www.videoask.com/help/integrations/360039126292-videoask-api


# Using production API credentials

Now that we've created your app with VideoAsk, you can write the application itself using your own `client_id` and `client_secret`. Your application will need to generate an access token (and possibly also a refresh token) to integrate with VideoAsk's APIs. This requires making authorization and authentication requests through your browser-based application.

The first request, `GET https://auth.videoask.com/authorize`, confirms your `client_id`, prompts the user to grant the permissions your app requires, and returns a temporary authorization code.
The second request, `POST https://api.videoask.com/oauth/token`, confirms your temporary authorization code and returns your access token.

Your application's https://api.videoask.com/authorize link, including parameters, might look like this:

```
https://auth.videoask.com/authorize?response_type=code&audience=https://api.videoask.com/&client_id={your_client_id}&scope=openid%20profile%20email&redirect_uri=https://your-example-app.com/callback
```


Clicking the https://auth.videoask.com/authorize link in your app should redirect to the VideoAsk login screen so users can log in to their VideoAsk accounts. Then, they'll see a consent screen that lists the scope of access and prompts them to grant or deny access to your app.

If the user grants access to your app, VideoAsk generates a temporary authorization code and redirects the browser to a URL that includes the code. Here's what that redirect URL might look like:

```
https://your-example-app.com/callback?code={temporary_authorization_code}
```

item.name: Forms

request.description:
Retrieves a list of JSON descriptions for all forms (videoasks) in your VideoAsk account. Forms are sorted by creation date in descending order.

Fields for pagination:
- `offset`: to indicate from which answer we want to start the page
- `limit`: to indicate the size of the page

request.description:
Search for form titles within your organization that match a specific keyword or search term.

Forms are listed in chronological order; oldest forms will appear at the top of the list.

The `limit` parameter can be used to limit how many matching forms are listed.

Use the `id` returned in the response to retrieve more detailed information about the specific form.

request.description:
new_organization_id is the organization_id of the form's destination.

To move a form from Organization A to Organization B, you must be:

*   The account owner of Organization A (admin permissions are insufficient)
*   A team member of Organization B
    

The form will be moved to the root folder of the organization.

The response will contain full weeks report within the interval dates if interval is `weekly`.

For reporting purposes, weeks will start on Mondays and end on Sundays. If the dates given as start or end doesn't correspond to the exact start or end of the week, the whole week containing that date will be included in the report (see example).
Retrieves a question by the given `question_id`.

item.name: Create a question with external media

response.name: Create an open question with external video
Create a poll with external video

request.description:
To upload your own media on Question creation, you need to send the mime_type of the media on the question creation endpoint. In this example we are using a webm video `mime_type = video/webm;codecs=vp8,opus` and a thumbnail that is a jpeg `thumbnail_mime_type = image/jpeg`

In the response of question creation it returns a special field `media_upload` which will contain the pre-signed URL to upload your media and optionally your thumbnail

To upload your video or audio files you need to send one additional PUT request to the address that is on the field `presigned_url`.

In this request you need to include the header `Content-Type` with the same `mime_type` that you used on question creation.
Ex:
```
PUT <presigned_url>
Content-Type: video/webm;codecs=vp8,opus

"<file contents here>"
```

For the thumbnail you need to send another PUT request to `thumbnail_presigned_url`

```
PUT <thumbnail_presigned_url>
Content-Type: image/jpeg

"<file contents here>"
```

request.description:
You may want to re-use a media that was previously uploaded to VideoAsk as the video for a question. You could achieve this by passing the corresponding `media_id`.  
  
By doing so, you will save storage space in your organization.  
  
The media could be a previously recorded video, a file uploaded, or VideoAsk's answer.

request.description: The duplicated question will be added to the form but you will need to set up logic actions to connect the duplicated question to the flow.

To update the media in the question, using own media, you need to send the mime_type of the media on the question update endpoint. In this example we are using a webm video `mime_type = video/webm;codecs=vp8,opus` and a thumbnail that is a jpeg `thumbnail_mime_type = image/jpeg`

In the response of question update it returns a special field `media_upload` which will contain the pre-signed URL to upload your media and optionally your thumbnail

To upload your video or audio files you need to send one additional PUT request to the address that is on the field `presigned_url`.

In this request you need to include the header `Content-Type` with the same `mime_type` that you used on question creation.
Ex:
```
PUT <presigned_url>
Content-Type: video/webm;codecs=vp8,opus

"<file contents here>"
```

For the thumbnail you need to send another PUT request to `thumbnail_presigned_url`

```
PUT <thumbnail_presigned_url>
Content-Type: image/jpeg

"<file contents here>"
```

item.description: The Responses API lets you access the data your videoasks collect â€” on demand and in JSON format â€” without setting up webhooks or third-party integrations.

request.description: `email` is the only required field; `name` and `phone_number` are optional.
You can find `respondent_id` in the webhook response whenever your videoask receives a new response and the respondent has provided their contact details.

You can retrieve the `media_id` of content by webhook, API call, or right-clicking the content, copying the video address, and finding the `media_id` (after `/transcoded/` and before `/video.mp4` in the URL).

item.description:
Where do you want to send your videoaskâ€™s data? With our Webhooks API, you can send every response straight to any URL or compatible web application as soon as itâ€™s submitted or when it's finished transcribing.

You can set them up in the `Connect` tab of your videoask, or by using the endpoints described here.

# Key concepts

Webhooks are notifications that are triggered automatically when a specific event occurs and sent through the web. With the VideoAsk Webhooks API, the event can be a new response submission or a new response submission after the transcription process finished. When a new event comes in, a notification that contains the response data is immediately sent to your chosen destination: the URL or web application you set. Your webhook endpoint should accept our `POST` request and send back a `2XX` HTTP response status code to let us know that you received the webhook data successfully.

If a webhook request fails for any reason, VideoAsk will retry the request to your endpoint 3 times using a back-off mechanism after 5, 10, and 20 minutes.


# Event types

## `form_response`

Triggers as soon as a videoask is completed/abandoned and all video/audio media is transcoded.

item.name: Branding

request.description:
Retrieves a list of JSON descriptions for all brandings in your VideoAsk account. Brandings are sorted by creation date in descending order.

Fields for pagination:
- `offset`: to indicate from which answer we want to start the page
- `limit`: to indicate the size of the page

request.description: Retrieves a branding by the given `branding_id`

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

formdata.description: The subdomain of the brand's domain where videoasks will be served through

item.description:
The Brandings API lets you give a customized feeling to the videoasks in your account. 

You can create or modify one or more brandings for your videoasks to use.

With a branding you can set a custom logo and url in your videoasks, or set a white label domain from where to serve your videoasks and where the brand's customers will be able to answer back.
